title: 114_hr292
content: The Act is titled the "Advancing Research for Neurological Diseases Act of 2015" and includes a section on the National Neurological Diseases Surveillance System. The Act titled "Advancing Research for Neurological Diseases Act of 2015" mandates the creation of the National Neurological Diseases Surveillance System to track and research neurological diseases like multiple sclerosis and Parkinson's disease. The system will collect data on the incidence and prevalence of these diseases. The National Neurological Diseases Surveillance System will collect data on the incidence, prevalence, demographics, risk factors, diagnosis, and progression markers of neurological diseases in the United States. The National Neurological Diseases Surveillance System will gather data on the epidemiology, natural history, prevention, detection, management, treatment approaches, and outcomes measures of neurological diseases. The Secretary will consult with experts in epidemiology, disease surveillance, national health associations focusing on neurological diseases like multiple sclerosis and Parkinson's disease. The Secretary may award grants to public or private nonprofit entities for activities related to the National Neurological Diseases Surveillance System, including experts in research, care, patient services, health information technology, clinicians with expertise in neurological diseases, and research scientists with experience in translational research or surveillance systems. Coordination with other federal agencies is required for sharing information and analysis from the system. The National Neurological Diseases Surveillance System data will be accessible to federal departments, agencies, and the public. Privacy and security measures will be in place, meeting HIPAA standards. A report is required within 4 years. The Secretary must submit a report to Congress within 4 years on the National Neurological Diseases Surveillance System, including information on data collection, use, and coordination of databases for neurological diseases. The term 'national voluntary health association' is defined as a national nonprofit organization with chapters or networks in the US. Authorization of Appropriations: $5,000,000 for each fiscal year from 2015 to 2019 is authorized to carry out this section.
